While examining a thin slice of cork, Robert
Hooke saw that the cork r esembled the
structur e of a honeycomb consisting of many
little compartments. Cork is  a substance

was in the year 1665 when Hooke made this

microscope. Robert Hooke called these boxes
cells. Cell is a Latin word for ‘a little r oom’.
This may seem to be a very small and
insignificant incident but it is very important
in the history of science. This was the very first
time that someone had observed that living
things appear to consist of separate units. The
use of the word ‘cell’ to describe these units is
being used till this day in biology.
Let us find out about cells.
